sourceResource.title: Water infrastructure successful strategies for local leadership /

subject.name: Federal aid to water quality management--United States--Interactive multimedia

sourceResource.rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain. For more information please see http://www.gpo.gov/help/index.html#public_domain_copyright_notice.htm
publisher: [Washington, D.C.] : U. S. Environmental Protection Agency, Local Government Advisory Committee
sourceResource.title: Water infrastructure successful strategies for local leadership /
description: A chartered Federal Advisory Committee offering advice to the Administrator, U.S. Environmental Protection Agency.
Also available via Internet from EPA web site. Address as of 5/15/08: http://www.epa.gov/waterinfrastructure/lgac_video/index.html; current access available via PURL.

The DVD features five local officials telling how they successfully met the needs of their communities for sustainable water infrastructure. The staggering costs of maintaining and improving our water and wastewater systems challenge local leaders in practically every American community.
Case studies: Gloucester, Massachusetts--Freeport, Illinois--Douglas County, Colorado--Village of Haskins, Ohio--Half Moon Bay, California.
Winner of a 2007 Telly Award to honor outstanding local, regional, and cable TV commercials and programs.

marc:subfield.#text: U. S. Environmental Protection Agency, Local Government Advisory Committee,
System requirements: DVD player or PC with DVD-Rom drive; Windows Media Player.
"A chartered Federal Advisory Committee offering advice to the Administrator, U.S. Environmental Protection Agency."
Also available via Internet from EPA web site. Address as of 5/15/08: http://www.epa.gov/waterinfrastructure/lgac_video/index.html; current access available via PURL.

The DVD features five local officials telling how they successfully met the needs of their communities for sustainable water infrastructure. The staggering costs of maintaining and improving our water and wastewater systems challenge local leaders in practically every American community.
Case studies: Gloucester, Massachusetts -- Freeport, Illinois -- Douglas County, Colorado -- Village of Haskins, Ohio -- Half Moon Bay, California.

sourceResource.title: Making sun-earth connections sun-earth connection education forum

sourceResource.rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain. For more information please see http://www.gpo.gov/help/index.html#public_domain_copyright_notice.htm
publisher: [Washington, D.C.?] : NASA/Goddard Space Flight Center ; UC Berkeley's Space Sciences Laboratory
sourceResource.title: Making sun-earth connections sun-earth connection education forum
description: Computer programs and visual and text data.

A multimedia educational presentation on the sun and its effects on the earth, including components for elementary, middle, and high schools with corresponding teachers' guides. The general public can share the excitement of discoveries and knowledge generated by space science missions and research programs.
Also available via Internet from the NASA web site. Address as of 2/22/01: http://sunearth.gsfc.nasa.gov/sechtml/what.html ; current access is available via PURL.

marc:subfield.#text: NASA/Goddard Space Flight Center ; UC Berkeley's Space Sciences Laboratory,
Computer programs and visual and text data.

A multimedia educational presentation on the sun and its effects on the earth, including components for elementary, middle, and high schools with corresponding teachers' guides. The general public can share the excitement of discoveries and knowledge generated by space science missions and research programs.
Also available via Internet from the NASA web site. Address as of 2/22/01: http://sunearth.gsfc.nasa.gov/sechtml/what.html ; current access is available via PURL.
Disc includes Adobe Acrobat Reader 4.0 and QuickTime 4.0 software.
System requirements (Mac users): Power Mac (PPC); System 7.1.2 or later; 12 MB of memory; any Macintosh compatible monitor; CD-ROM drive.
System requirements (PC users): PC with 486 or higher processor (faster is better); 12 MB memory; Windows 95 or Windows NT 3.51 with service pack 5.x or later; CD-ROM drive.

subject.name: Justice, Administration of--Moral and ethical aspects--United States

sourceResource.title: Religions, cultures and communities
description: Title from HTML index page (viewed May 21, 2009)..

This DVD series explores some of the many religions and cultures with which law enforcement officials come into contact. Each video clip offers tips on working with people of different faiths and backgrounds, including suggestions for inoffensive law enforcement techniques.
Vol. 1. Religions (85 min.)--vol. 2. Cultures and communities. (65 min.)

sourceResource.title: After the storm a citizen's video guide to understanding stormwater /
description: Also available via Internet from the Clu-in website. Address as of 3/16/07: http://www.clu-in.org/search/t.focus/id/602/; current access via PURL.

Protecting the nation's water resources will take the awareness and effort of individual citizens. Three case studies focus on the interconnections between water supply, water quality and the economic vitality and quality of life in our communities.

sourceResource.title: Working with stress
Working with stress
description: Content supervisors, Steven Sauter, Larry Murphy, Naomi Swanson; script review, Michael Colligan; Joseph Hurrell; animations, Artboy.
For use in set-top DVD players and computer DVD drives. Not designed for CD-ROM drives"--Disc label.
Also available via Internet from the NIOSH Web site. Address as of 03/11/04: http://www.cdc.gov/niosh/docs/video/stress1.html; current access is available via PURL.
Job stress can pose a health threat to workers and the well-being of an organization. This presentation provides information about ways to manage and overcome stressful work environments.
DVD also contains information about NIOSH and additional resources.
